channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Where is Imran Khan? Why are his death rumours circulating online again?
Do we finally know what dark matter that makes up a quarter of the cosmos is?
After Australia, Deloitte’s AI scandal in Canada: A global consulting crisis in the making?
How 19 CISF bravehearts thwarted Pakistan's attack on Uri hydro plant
How Indian-American US diplomat has exposed fraud in H-1B visa programme
Karoline Leavitt says she has PTSD. How stressful is it to be White House press secretary?
Why six-decade-long American embargo on Cuba must end now
item.description: On October 29, 2025, the UN General Assembly adopted a resolution calling for an end to the United States’ decades-long embargo against Cuba

item.title: Dharmendra: The timeless star who redefined the ‘leading man’
item.description: Amidst Bachchan and Kaka—and long before the Khans mastered tonal fluidity—Dharmendra had shown that a leading man could move from drama to comedy to romance without ever losing authenticity

item.title: Head-on | The West’s veto over India’s rise has expired
item.description: The outcome a declining West fears most is one Asian power, China, being joined at the top by another Asian power, India. The West’s veto to prevent that outcome, however, has expired

item.title: G20 Johannesburg summit affirmed India’s stature and PM Modi’s status
item.description: With Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping absent, Prime Minister Narendra Modi was the senior-most statesman present at the summit and he played the role with confidence

item.title: As rift widens, Afghanistan turns to India to break Pakistan’s trade grip
item.description: It will be difficult for Afghanistan to substitute the Pakistani route, but the Taliban want to gain new options and India must assist them in this effort.

item.title: India-Israel FTA talks signal how middle-power democracies can shape global economy
item.description: The world’s most populous country is no longer just a market; it is a gateway to Asia and potentially one of the most influential actors shaping the global economic order. Israel’s decision to fast-track the trade agreement talks reflects this recognition
